bibl.title: Letter from R. Hart Phillips to Philip Showalter Hench, November 26, 1952

div1.p: Phillips informs Hench that the park on the site of Camp Lazear will be called “Campamento Lazear.” Building No. 1 will be called “Caseta No. 1” only, with no reference to Reed. A photographer will be available to take pictures during the dedication ceremony at Camp Lazear. The President of Cuba will speak at the end of the ceremony.

div1.head: Letter from R. Hart Phillips to Philip Showalter Hench, November 26, 1952
div1.opener:
Thank you for letter & data
give by Mrs my full
thank to editorial
Richmon
R. HART PHILLIPS.
CORRESPONDENT IN CUBA FOR
The New York Times,
REFUGIO 106. ALTOS
HAVANA, CUBA
----
Nov. 26, 1952.
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I am sorry about the delay in replying to your
letter but sometimes these things are much delayed in locating
the person who is actually doing the work of organization.

However, we have now been given full information
showing that the park will be called “Campamento Lazear.” One
of the small houses, No. 2, seems to have fallen down so the
government restored No. 1, which will apparently only be called
Caseta No. 1. No one seems to have any information that it will
bear a name of any kind.

Figures of Drs. Carlos J. Finlay, Claudio Delgado,
General Leonardo Wood, Walter Reed, Jesse Lazear, James Carroll
and Aristides Agramonte will be unveiled by James Leonard Hanberry,
listed as the only survivor of the volunteers of Campamento Lazear.

I notice of course that you are listed on the
program as speaking and that President Batista will speak at the
end of the ceremony.

We got in touch with Mr. Aldo E. Diaz, who
is now a photographer for the newspaper “Informacion”. He will
call you at the National Hotel at 6 p.m. on Dec. 2nd. You did
not tell me when you expect to be here but I imagine that you
will be at the National and will be in town at that time. If
you miss him, we will get in touch with him again. He said he
remembered you and would be glad to help you. However, may I
say that I do not believe his prices will be anything like they
were formerly.

I shall look forward with pleasure to seeing
you again in Havana.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, R Phillips Dr. P. S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minnesota.
